patterns: What can you do for me?
responses: I'm happy to help. How can I assist you?
Absolutely! Tell me what information you need.
Of course, how can I support you?

patterns: What is the Vice Provost's name
responses: The Vice Provost for Research + Scholarship is Dr. Erin Kobetz, PhD, MPH.
Erin Kobetz, PhD, MPH is the Vice Provost for Research + Scholarship.
The Vice Provost for Research + Scholarship leads several research-enabling functions at the U.

The VPRS oversees several divisions that focus on Research + Scholarship, including Research Development and Evaluation, Research Intelligence, Research Capacity & Operations, Research Administration, and Regulatory Affairs and Assessment.

The VPRS oversees many aspects of Research + Scholarship at the U, from helping find a team and funding to resources for animal studies and human subjects research. Learn more in 'About Research at the University' in the top navigation bar.
We have lots of information to help you navigate the office in the VPRS. Check them out in Research at the University > OVPRS Administrative Areas.

patterns: i need to talk to ORA
what is office of research administration
responses: Research Administration at the U helps researchers with sponsored proposals, contract negotiations, and managing sponsored funds. Find them at ora.miami.edu.
Research Administration has experts working on pre-award, contract negotiations, and post-award management. Find them at ora.miami.edu.
Research Administration helps with all financial aspects of applying for and managing grants, and is the entity that approves billing rates for the University. Find them at ora.miami.edu.

Our Research Development and Evalution team manages internal funding mechanisms, including the Provost's Research Awards, Arts & Humanities Fellowships, and U-LINK. Find them in About Research at the University > OVPRS Administrative Areas.
To find out more about the Provost's Research Awards, visit About Research at the University > OVPRS Administrative Areas > Research Development and Evaluation
Our Research IT division supports users of research applications, including ePROST, Complion and UDisclose. Email their support system at resinfo@med.miami.edu to create a ticket.
The Division of Veterinary Resources manages requests for animals for use in research. Learn more here: https://research.miami.edu/about/admin-areas/rco/dvr/index.html
Our Division of Veterinary Resources cares for all the animals we use in research. Learn more here: https://research.miami.edu/about/admin-areas/rco/dvr/index.html

there is a complaint about a service
responses: Please provide us your complaint in order to assist you. Email vprs@miami.edu.
Please mention your complaint, we will reach you and sorry for any inconvenience caused. Email vprs@miami.edu.

Questions about foreign engagements and partnerships? Visit https://research.miami.edu/about/admin-areas/raa/foreign-influence/index.html.
UDisclose is the electronic system the University uses, allowing individuals to disclose external financial interests, foreign engagements and other disclosures.
UDisclose is the University's disclosure system. Login here: http://udisclose.miami.edu.
All full- and part-time active faculty are required to complete a disclosure between March 17th and May 31st. Login here: http://udisclose.miami.edu.

patterns: Does my study team need to disclose
responses: Study team members who are not faculty do not need to disclose at this time, unless they are designated to a new award/study/contract under UM’s current interest disclosure process.

patterns: do I need to register in the system
how do i login to udisclose
responses: A UDisclose profile has most likely already been created for you, even if you haven't disclosed before. Login here: http://udisclose.miami.edu.

Only certain employees bound to our confidentiality policies will be able to access and review your information. Also, to the greatest extent possible, your information will not be shared outside the University.

patterns: do part-time faculty need to disclose
do volunteer faculty need to disclose
i am faculty, do i have to disclose
i am part time, do i have to disclose
responses: All full- and part-time active faculty, including those on sabbatical or leave, are required to complete a disclosure between March 17th and May 31st.

patterns: Why should I disclose private information about my outside interests to UM
why do i need to disclose
responses: Disclosure of interests related to institutional responsibilities not only ensures an investigator’s compliance with federal regulations and UM policies, but also allows identification and management of conflicts of interest.
Disclosure serves to protect the reputations of the investigators and of the institution.

Financial interests are: Ownership (valued at $600 or more) in a public company, Any ownership in a privately held company, or Any ownership in a privately held company. An Obligatory Interest is a relationship (regardless of compensation) that involves a responsibility or commitment to an external entity.

A financial interest means anything of monetary value, whether or not the quantitative value is readily ascertainable, that is related to your institutional responsibilities. An obligatory interest means a relationship (regardless of compensation) that involves a responsibility or commitment to an external entity.

All non-University professional activities performed for remuneration, including lecturing, delivering professional advice, expert witness testimony, arbitration, government services, corporate board activities, royalties, and private practice (which is only allowed for services that do not violate University of Miami Medical Group (UMMG) by-laws or compete with services that are or could be offered by the University). Only OPAs performed for $600 or more must be disclosed to the University.

patterns: do i need to disclose travel
responses: Only those investigators who are involved with Public Health Service (PHS)-funded projects need to disclose sponsored or reimbursed trips they have taken and only if the travel was related to their institutional responsibilities.

patterns: how do i send to listserv
responses: The Office of the Vice Provost for Research maintains several e-mail distribution lists (listservs) for the University community. For more information: https://research.miami.edu/about/listserv/index.html

patterns: what are the research shared resources
responses: A number of core facilities and shared resources developed at the University of Miami are available to researchers and trainees. See them all here: https://research.miami.edu/about/labs-facilities/index.html

Tonya Sautier is the Senior Business Officer for the Office of the Vice Provost for Research + Scholarship, she leads all aspects of budget, finance, human resources, operations, administration, and special projects for the organization.

Laura Kozma is the Associate Vice President for Research Administration. She  provides leadership for sponsored administration which includes proposal review and approval, contract negotiations, award management and compliance monitoring, and serves as audit liaison for the Institution for sponsored awards.

Johanna Stamates is the Associate Vice President for Regulatory Affairs and Assessment. She oversees several offices in the VPRS helping to ensure that University researchers work to a world-class standard.

patterns: join a lab as a student
responses: The University prides itself on involving students in research at every level in their academic career. Learn more here: https://research.miami.edu/learners/index.html
University support includes one-on-one grant writing support and specialized resources for any kind of investigation. Learn more here: https://research.miami.edu/lifecycle/write-proposal/index.html

patterns: how do i get grant funding
responses: The University provides access to global databases for research administration and funding opportunities. Learn more here: https://research.miami.edu/lifecycle/identify-opportunities/index.html
